definitions.definition: to come out of your mother’s body at the beginning of your life
definitions.sensetop: born into somethingborn of/to somebodyborn with something+ adj.+ noun

examples.text: I was born in 1996.
He was born in a small village in northern Spain.
She was born on 7 February 1874.
The baby was **born by Caesarean section** on Friday.
She was born into a very musical family.
These children were born into poverty.
He was born of/to German parents.
She was born with a rare heart condition.
She was born with a weak heart.
Her brother was **born blind** *(= was blind when he was born)*.
John Wayne was born Marion Michael Morrison *(= that was his name at birth)*.
She was born into a wealthy family.
Their child was born with a serious medical problem.
babies who are born to very young mothers
to be born of noble parents
the city where the protest movement was born
She acted with a courage born (out) of desperation.

definitions.definition: born in the order, way, place, etc. mentioned

examples.text: firstborn
nobly born
French-born
The part is played by an American-born actress.

definitions.definition: to behave or do things in a particular manner because it is part of your character

examples.text: It's not his fault he's so pompous—he was born that way.

definitions.definition: to have something as your destiny (= what is certain to happen to you) from birth

examples.text: He was born to be a great composer.

definitions.definition: born and having grown up in a particular place with a particular background and education

examples.text: He was born and bred in Boston.
I'm a Londoner, born and bred.
I was born and bred in Texas.

definitions.definition: used when you are very surprised at something you have never heard or seen before

examples.text: I've never heard such nonsense in all my born days.

definitions.definition: used to say that you are not stupid enough to believe what somebody is telling you

examples.text: Oh yeah? I wasn't born yesterday, you know.

definitions.definition: to have an easy life without realizing how easy it is

examples.text: You people without kids don't know you're born.

definitions.definition: used to say that somebody is very stupid
as if something is natural for you and you have done it many times in the past

examples.text: She adapted to life on the estate as if to the manner born.

wordOrigin: Old English boren, past participle of beran ‘to bear’, of Germanic origin; from an Indo-European root shared by Sanskrit bharati, Greek pherein, and Latin ferre.
